name: exothermic

releasing heat: exothermic reaction In an exothermic reaction, energy is released to the surroundings. The reaction between hydrogen and oxygen is highly exothermic. Condensation and freezing are exothermic processes. An exothermic compound is formed from its elements by releasing heat energy. Compare
endothermic
More examplesFewer examplesThe production of ammonia is an exothermic reaction.The breaking of bonds is an endothermic process requiring energy, while the making of bonds is an exothermic process with energy being released.The reaction on the surface is exothermic, so the gases heat up.A nuclear power plant is exothermic. It generates tons of heat into the biosphere that never would have been there otherwise.
